ACT
244
Powers and duties of a notary public
As a court trustee in probate proceedings, a notary public, based on the court's decision on entrustment, carries out actions and makes decisions prescribed by this Act.
In cases referred to in Articles 222, 223 and 224 of this Act, the notary public shall return the file to the competent court.
In the cases referred to in Articles 140, 143 and 144 of this Act, the notary public can make decisions only with the consent of all parties to the proceedings. Otherwise, they will return the file to the competent court.
After the finality of the decision ending the proceedings, i.e. on the occasion of a stated objection, as well as in other cases when, according to the provisions of this Act, the file is returned to the competent court, the notary public shall return the file to the competent court, and keep a copy of the decision entrusting the implementation of probate proceedings in the notary's file, a copy of the death certificate, a copy of the decision on inheritance, a record or another act that ends the procedure before the notary public and returns the file to the court.
